enum16.name: Object Type
enum16.tooltip: changing this would not be wise

bit.name: Object Uses Only Own Static Lightmap
Search Cardinal Direction Lightmaps On Failure
Extension Of Parent
bit.tooltip: object uses parent's markers

bit.name: Sample Environment Lighting Only Ignore Object Lighting
Effects Created By This Object Do Not Spawn Objects In Multiplayer
Does Not Collide With Camera
bit.tooltip: force camera not to collide with object. By default small sweetener objects do not collide

bit.name: Force Collide With Camera
bit.tooltip: force the camera to collide with this object, By default small sweetener objects do not collide

bit.name: Damage Not Blocked By Obstructions
bit.tooltip: AOE damage being applied to this object does not test for obstrutions.

bit.name: Grab Parent Object In Forge Editing
Never Use Imposter For Shadow Generation

float32.name: Bounding Radius
float32.tooltip: If you edit this field manually, beware that the render model is no longer respected for radius calculation and that you need to set the bounding offset as well.

float32.name: Dynamic Light Sphere Radius
float32.tooltip: sphere to use for dynamic lights and shadows. only used if not 0

tagRef.name: Collision Damage
tagRef.tooltip: only set this tag if you want to override the default collision damage values in globals.globals

tagRef.name: Melee Sound
tagRef.tooltip: this is the sound that is made when I am meleed. This overrides the sweetener sound of my material.

float32.name: Self-Destruct Time
float32.tooltip: if non-zero, any instances of this object will destroy themselves after this many seconds.

stringid.name: Interaction Name
stringid.tooltip: if you checked the consider for interaction flag, type what interaction the AI should do with this object

bit.name: Invert
bit.tooltip: result of function is one minus actual result

bit.name: Mapping Does Not Controls Active
bit.tooltip: the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive

bit.name: Always Active
bit.tooltip: function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

bit.name: Random Time Offset
bit.tooltip: function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1

bit.name: Always Exports Value
bit.tooltip: when this function is deactivated, it still exports its value

bit.name: Turn Off With Uses Magnitude
bit.tooltip: the function will be turned off if the value of the turns_off_with function is 0

stringid.name: Import Name
stringid.tooltip: if you leave this field blank then you can set this function's input value with the hs_function object_set_function_variable

stringid.name: Turn Off With
stringid.tooltip: if the specified function is off, so is this function

stringid.name: Ranged Interpolation Name
stringid.tooltip: if you have the ranged button checked

float32.name: Minimum Value
float32.tooltip: function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

tagblock.name: Interpolation

option.name: Fractional
option.tooltip: covers a fixed fraction of the distance to the target on each update

float32.name: Linear Travel Time
float32.tooltip: used by constant velocity

float32.name: Acceleration
float32.tooltip: used by linear acceleration

tagblock.comment: the damping ratio is c/(2*sqrt(k)). if this ratio is: = 0 : oscillates forever < 1 : oscillates with decreasing amplitude = 1 : reaches the target precisely and quickly (no oscillation) > 1 : reaches the target slowly the higher the value of k, the quicker the system will reach the target value

float32.name: Spring k
float32.tooltip: used by damped spring, determines acceleration by displacement

float32.name: Spring c
float32.tooltip: used by damped spring, determines damping based on velocity

float32.name: Fraction
float32.tooltip: used by fractional, how mush of the distance to the target to cover each update

int32.name: Runtime Interpolator To Object Function Mapping

rangef.name: Selection Bounds
rangef.tooltip: if the switch function is between these values, this function will be picked

bit.name: Update State Animation and Keyframe Rigid Bodies Every Frame
Force Always On
bit.tooltip: when this flag is clear we only create the attachment when the function object function is active or set to empty string

bit.name: Effect Size Scale From Object Scale
Works On Land
bit.tooltip: drives on an extruded version of everything physical in your level

stringId.name: Variant Name
stringId.tooltip: if empty, may be used by any model variant

bit.name: Blend In HSV
bit.tooltip: blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space

bit.name: ...More Colors
bit.tooltip: blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

tagblock.name: Multiplayer Object

flags8.name: Game Engine Flags
flags8.tooltip: Set which game engines you desire this object to appear in

tagblock.comment: Type pertains to how you want the game engine to handle this object Certain flags applicable only to certain object types, should be self evident
These fields are only used for goal area objects with boundaries, and for respawn zones
These fields are used for default spawning times and remapping
These are respawn zone weights, used only for respawn zones

tagblock.name: Falloff Function
tagblock.tooltip: Multiplier applied to weight (domain is center to radius, range should be 0 to 1).

tagblock.comment: These fields are only used for defining certain, special markers to use for positional locations if the default position (object origin) is not sufficient

tagref.name: Spawned Object
tagref.tooltip: If this object is intended to spawn something, the object it spawns should be specified here

tagref.name: Simulation Interpolation
tagref.tooltip: Set to a specific interpolation definition, or leave blank to inherit the default for the object type (there are defaults for bipeds, vehicles, and crates in multiplayer_globals). To disable interpolation on a particular object whose type has interpolation by default, set this reference to the special disable_interpolation.simulation_interpolation tag.

tagblock.name: Spawn Effects
tagblock.comment: Effect played when an object of this type spawns in during each game mode. Unlike creation effect, it is only played when the object spawns in through certain methods, not whenever one is created.

tagRef.name: Multiplayer Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in MP games

tagRef.name: Survival Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in Firefight games

tagRef.name: Campaign Spawn Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect played when this object spawns in Campaign games

bit.name: Blocks Headshots
bit.tooltip: like jackal shield

bit.name: Use Ground Scale For All Unspecified Attachments
Fixup Position Upon Detaching From Parent
Fixup Position After Attaching To Parent

plugin.comment: because grenades look better as coconuts. 0==1

tagref.name: Grounded Friction Settings
tagref.tooltip: If not present, the default from global.globals is used.

tagref.name: Tossed Override
tagref.tooltip: Used to override the object tossed when item owner is killed. Is overridden by tossed weapon override.

bit.name: Hide FP Weapon When In Iron Sights
bit.tooltip: for scoped weapons

bit.name: Weapon Ages With Each Kill
bit.tooltip: see 'weapon ages when damage is inflicted', 'per kill or hit aging amount'

bit.name: Strict Deviation Angle
bit.tooltip: deviation angle is allowed to be less than primary autoaim angle - for the rocket launcher

bit.name: Notifies Target Units
bit.tooltip: aiming this weapon at another player can be important to them - for lock-on weapons

bit.name: Non-Lunge Melee Dash Disabled
bit.tooltip: melee-physics dash is disabled on melees that are not lunges

bit.name: Don't Drop On Dual Wield Melee
Is Equipment Special Weapon
bit.tooltip: when checked, this weapon: is deleted when dropped, does not count against maximum inventory, gets deleted on host migrations, prevents swapping or switching weapons

bit.name: Force Tracers To Come From Weapon Barrel
bit.tooltip: setting this forces effects tracers to come from weapon barrel instead of eye point

bit.name: AI Cannot Fire Tracking Projectiles
bit.tooltip: setting this will remove tracking data from AI-fired projectiles

bit.name: Second Barrel Fires If Friend Is Targeted
bit.tooltip: bishop beam support- primary barrel fires if foe is targeted, secondary if targeting friend

bit.name: Weapon Unzooms On Damage
bit.tooltip: taking damage while wielding this will ping player out of zoom/iron sights

bit.name: Do Not Drop On Equipment Activation
bit.tooltip: will counteract default support weapon behavior to drop on equipment activation

bit.name: Weapon Can Not Be Dropped
bit.tooltip: used for CTF magnum, weapon can not be dropped or swapped out

bit.name: Throw Weapon Instead Of Grenade
bit.tooltip: Throws weapon when grenade trigger is pressed

bit.name: Do Not Drop 'Must Be Readied' On Primary Trigger
bit.tooltip: Allows 'must be readied' weapons to have a primary attack

bit.name: Allow Melee When Using Device
bit.tooltip: Default behavior prevents melee attacks when using device. Setting this bit allows them.

bit.name: Do Not Lower Weapon When Using Device
bit.tooltip: Default behavior lowers weapon when using device. Setting this leaves the weapon up.

bit.name: Weapon Ages When Damage Is Inflicted
bit.tooltip: see 'weapon ages with each kill', 'per kill or hit aging amount'

bit.name: Apply Gunner Armor Mod Abilites
bit.tooltip: Apply weapon's gunner armor mod movement penalty multipliers rather than base multipliers when gunner armor mod is active in _trait_weapons_gunner_armor_modifier

bit.name: Wielders Sprint Is Unaffected By Soft Ping
bit.tooltip: see momentum globals 'disable soft ping check'

bit.name: Weapon Drops Further Away
bit.tooltip: Adds velocity to weapon's default drop (useful for weapons with auto-pickup)

bit.name: Do Not Drop On Assassination
bit.tooltip: Keeps the weapon in your hand while being assassinated or performing an assassination (for must_be_readied or support weapons)

bit.name: Is Part Of Body
bit.tooltip: Keeps the weapon from dropping or being hidden at the start of assassinations, and must instead be dropped using the drop weapon keyframe

bit.name: Force Deny Equipment Use
bit.tooltip: Disallows any equipment usage while holding this weapon regardless of any other traits you may have

bit.name: Hide Pickup Prompt Unless Special Pickup Priority
bit.tooltip: Used for Oddball that only shows the pickup prompt when megalo script sets pickup priority to special

bit.name: Weapon Ignores Player Pickup Allowed Trait
bit.tooltip: Player will always pickup this weapon if requested, Used for CTF that needs to force storm_magnum_ctf onto the player

int16.name: Maximum Alternate Shots Loaded
int16.tooltip: if the second trigger loads alternate ammunition, this is the maximum number of shots that can be loaded at a time

float32.name: Turn On Time
float32.tooltip: how long after being readied it takes this weapon to switch its 'turned_on' attachment to 1.0

tagRef.name: Vision Mode
tagRef.tooltip: activated when this weapon is charging

float32.name: Heat Recovery Threshold
float32.tooltip: the heat value a weapon must return to before leaving the overheated state, once it has become overheated in the first place

float32.name: Overheated Threshold
float32.tooltip: the heat value over which a weapon first becomes overheated (should be greater than the heat recovery threshold)

float32.name: Heat Detonation Threshold
float32.tooltip: the heat value above which the weapon has a chance of exploding each time it is fired

float32.name: Heat Detonation Fraction
float32.tooltip: the percent chance (between 0.0 and 1.0) the weapon will explode when fired over the heat detonation threshold

float32.name: Heat Loss Per Second
float32.tooltip: the amount of heat lost each second when the weapon is not being fired

stringid.name: Heat Loss Function
stringid.tooltip: function values sets the current heat loss per second

stringid.name: Heat Loss Venting Function
stringid.tooltip: function value sets the heat loss per second while weapon is being vented

float32.name: Heat Venting Exit Heat
float32.tooltip: heat at which to begin the venting exit animations so that the weapon is just about fully cooled when the exit animation completes.

float32.name: Heat Illumination
float32.tooltip: the amount of illumination given off when the weapon is overheated

float32.name: Heat Warning Threshold
float32.tooltip: the amount of heat at which a warning will be displayed on the hud

float32.name: Overheated Heat Loss Per Second
float32.tooltip: the amount of heat lost each second when the weapon is not being fired

stringid.name: Overheated Heat Loss Function
stringid.tooltip: function values sets the heat loss per second when weapon is overheated

degree2.name: Damage Pyramid Angles
degree2.tooltip: defines the frustum from the camera that the melee-attack uses to find targets

float32.name: Damage Pyramid Depth
float32.tooltip: 0 defaults to 0.8f. how far the melee attack searches for a target

float32.name: Maximum Lunge Range
float32.tooltip: 0 defaults to 1.22f

float32.name: Damage Lunge Explosive Depth
float32.tooltip: the distance out from the pyramid center to spawn explosive effects. This value will be clamped to the damage pyramid depth. 0 defaults to the damage pyramid depth

tagRef.name: Lunge Melee Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this is only important for the energy sword

tagRef.name: Lunge Melee Response
tagRef.tooltip: this is only important for the energy sword

tagRef.name: Empty Melee Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this is only important for the energy sword

tagRef.name: Empty Melee Response
tagRef.tooltip: this is only important for the energy sword

tagRef.name: Clang Melee Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this is only important for the energy sword

tagRef.name: Clang Melee Response
tagRef.tooltip: this is only important for the energy sword

tagRef.name: Clang Melee Against Melee Weapon Damage
tagRef.tooltip: e.g. used by AR to damage sword guy when clanging sword attack

tagRef.name: Clang Melee Against Melee Weapon Damage Response
tagRef.tooltip: e.g. used by AR to damage sword guy when clanging sword attack

tagref.name: Clang Effect
tagref.tooltip: effect that is played in the air between two players that clang with this weapon

int16.name: Magnification Levels
int16.tooltip: the number of magnification levels this weapon allows

int8.name: Zoom Effect Ticks
int8.tooltip: how often 'zoom effect' will be triggered (while zoomed)

tagRef.name: Zoom Effect
tagRef.tooltip: effect that is played while zoomed

plugin.comment: DEPRECATED. use aim assist modes below

float32.name: Autoaim Stick Time
float32.tooltip: the number of seconds that the crosshair needs to be on target before the larger autoaim stick kicks in

degree.name: Autoaim Stick Angle
degree.tooltip: the maximum angle that autoaim works to 'stick' a target. set to zero to use default behavior.

degree.name: Autoaim Angle
degree.tooltip: the maximum angle that autoaim works at full strength

float32.name: Autoaim Range
float32.tooltip: the maximum distance that autoaim works at full strength

float32.name: Autoaim Falloff Range
float32.tooltip: at what point the autoaim starts falling off

float32.name: Autoaim Near Falloff Range
float32.tooltip: at what point the autoaim reaches full power

degree.name: Magnetism Angle
degree.tooltip: the maximum angle that magnetism works at full strength

float32.name: Magnetism Range
float32.tooltip: the maximum distance that magnetism works at full strength

float32.name: Magnetism Falloff Range
float32.tooltip: at what point magnetism starts falling off

float32.name: Magnetism Near Falloff Range
float32.tooltip: at what point magnetism reaches full power

degree.name: Deviation Angle
degree.tooltip: the maximum angle that a projectile is allowed to deviate from the gun barrel due to autoaim OR network lead vector reconstruction

float32.name: Spread Multiplier
float32.tooltip: multiplies the spread error - use < 1.0 for more accuracy

float32.name: Movement Multiplier
float32.tooltip: multipliers player maximum move speed

float32.name: Auto Zoom Out Time
float32.tooltip: tick delay before zooming out upon release of iron sights zoom -- use 0 for single-zoom weapons, 5-10 for multi-zooms like sniper rifle

tagblock.name: Aim Assist Modes
tagblock.tooltip: First mode is normal, second mode is iron sights/scoped

float32.name: Autoaim Stick Time
float32.tooltip: the number of seconds that the crosshair needs to be on target before the larger autoaim stick kicks in

degree.name: Autoaim Stick Angle
degree.tooltip: the maximum angle that autoaim works to 'stick' a target. set to zero to use default behavior.

degree.name: Autoaim Angle
degree.tooltip: the maximum angle that autoaim works at full strength

float32.name: Autoaim Range
float32.tooltip: the maximum distance that autoaim works at full strength

float32.name: Autoaim Falloff Range
float32.tooltip: at what point the autoaim starts falling off

float32.name: Autoaim Near Falloff Range
float32.tooltip: at what point the autoaim reaches full power

degree.name: Magnetism Angle
degree.tooltip: the maximum angle that magnetism works at full strength

float32.name: Magnetism Range
float32.tooltip: the maximum distance that magnetism works at full strength

float32.name: Magnetism Falloff Range
float32.tooltip: at what point magnetism starts falling off

float32.name: Magnetism Near Falloff Range
float32.tooltip: at what point magnetism reaches full power

degree.name: Deviation Angle
degree.tooltip: the maximum angle that a projectile is allowed to deviate from the gun barrel due to autoaim OR network lead vector reconstruction

tagblock.name: Tracking Types
tagblock.tooltip: specify the kinds of targets this tracking system can lock on

plugin.comment: swim index 0 used when unzoomed, index 1 is for first zoom level, index 2 is 2nd zoom, etc.

rangef.name: Ballistic Arcing Firing Bounds
rangef.tooltip: At the min range (or closer), the minimum ballistic arcing is used, at the max (or farther away), the maximum arcing is used

rangef.name: Ballistic Arcing Fraction Bounds
rangef.tooltip: Controls speed and degree of arc. 0 = low, fast, 1 = high, slow

float32.name: Forward Movement Penalty
float32.tooltip: percent slowdown to forward movement for units carrying this weapon

float32.name: Sideways Movement Penalty
float32.tooltip: percent slowdown to sideways and backward movement for units carrying this weapon

float32.name: Gunner Armor Mod Forward Movement Penalty
float32.tooltip: percent slowdown to forward movement for units carrying this weapon with the gunner armor mod active

float32.name: Gunner Armor Mod Sideways Movement Penalty
float32.tooltip: percent slowdown to sideways and backward movement for units carrying this weapon with the gunner armor mod active

float32.name: Maximum Pitch Rate
float32.tooltip: This will cap the speed at which the player can aim when holding this weapon, probably want to set something sensible for turrets etc

float32.name: Ammopack Power Capacity
float32.tooltip: Ammopack armormod - 0.2 would give 20% additional capacity to an energy weapon

float32.name: Age Heat Recovery Penalty
float32.tooltip: how much the weapon's heat recovery is penalized as it ages

float32.name: Age Rate Of Fire Penalty
float32.tooltip: how much the weapon's rate of fire is penalized as it ages

float32.name: Age Misfire Start
float32.tooltip: the age threshold when the weapon begins to misfire

float32.name: Age Misfire Chance
float32.tooltip: at age 1.0, the misfire chance per shot

float32.name: Active Camo Ding
float32.tooltip: how much to decrease active camo when a round is fired

stringid.name: Handle Node
stringid.tooltip: the node that get's attached to the unit's hand

float32.name: First Person FOV Scale
float32.tooltip: the multiplier by the standard first person FOV to use when this weapon is held

float32.name: First Person DOF Distance
float32.tooltip: the distance to apply depth of field to the weapon

tagRef.name: Alternate HUD Screen Reference
tagRef.tooltip: the parent of the weapon can indicate that this hud should be used instead of the default

bit.name: Magazine Cannot Change State While Firing
bit.tooltip: will prevent reload until fire is complete (sticky det)

int16.name: Ammopack Rounds Total Initial
int16.tooltip: AmmoPack armormod - alternate total_initial value due to AmmoPack

int16.name: Ammopack Rounds Total Maximum
int16.tooltip: AmmoPack armormod - alternate total_maximum value due to armor mod AmmoPack

float32.name: Reload Dialogue Time
float32.tooltip: the length of time we wait before saying the reload dialogue

float32.name: Chamber Time
float32.tooltip: the length of time it takes to chamber the next round

option.name: Spew
option.tooltip: fires its primary action barrel whenever the trigger is down

option.name: Latch
option.tooltip: fires its primary action barrel when the trigger is down and then latches

option.name: Latch-Autofire
option.tooltip: fires its primary action barrel once if pulsed quickly or if not depressed all the way, otherwise does secondary behavior

option.name: Latch-Tether
option.tooltip: tethers projectiles if latched long enough, on release the tethered projectile detonates

option.name: Latch-Zoom
option.tooltip: latched; fires its primary action barrel when unzoomed, secondary when zoomed

option.name: Double-Latch-Tether
option.tooltip: projectile is tethered by 1st latch, 2nd releases and detonates it

option.name: Charge-With-Magazine
option.tooltip: like charge, but pays attention to any magazine and will not charge unless magazine is idle and barrel is actually able to fire

float32.name: Charging Time
float32.tooltip: the amount of time it takes for this trigger to become fully charged

float32.name: Charged Time
float32.tooltip: the amount of time this trigger can be charged before becoming overcharged

bit.name: Can Fire From Partial Charge
bit.tooltip: discharging a partially charged weapon will spew for the charged fraction of the spew time set below

bit.name: Limit To Current Rounds Loaded
bit.tooltip: if magazine present, do not fire more than current rounds loaded (mantis rocket launcher)

bit.name: Won't Charge Unless Tracked Target Is Valid
bit.tooltip: spew-charge triggers only

int16.name: Cancelled Trigger Throw
int16.tooltip: 96 was the constant in code for the pp

float32.name: Charged Illumination
float32.tooltip: the amount of illumination given off when the weapon is fully charged

tagRef.name: Charging Effect
tagRef.tooltip: the charging effect is created once when the trigger begins to charge

tagRef.name: Charging Damage Effect
tagRef.tooltip: the charging effect is created once when the trigger begins to charge

tagRef.name: Charging Continuous Damage Response
tagRef.tooltip: plays every tick you're charging or charged, scaled to charging fraction

float32.name: Charged Drain Rate
float32.tooltip: how much battery to drain per second when charged

tagRef.name: Discharge Effect
tagRef.tooltip: the discharging effect is created once when the trigger releases its charge

tagRef.name: Discharge Damage Effect
tagRef.tooltip: the discharging effect is created once when the trigger releases its charge

float32.name: Charge Fraction
float32.tooltip: charging fraction at which the weapon should additionally fire a shot.

tagRef.name: Double Latch Projectile Releasable Effect
tagRef.tooltip: created once player is able to release the tethered projectile

tagRef.name: Double Latch Projectile Released Effect
tagRef.tooltip: created when player releases the tethered projectile

tagblock.name: Barrels

bit.name: Random Firing Effects
bit.tooltip: rather than being chosen sequentially, firing effects are picked randomly

bit.name: Can Fire With Partial Ammo
bit.tooltip: allows a weapon to be fired as long as there is a non-zero amount of ammunition loaded

bit.name: Projectiles Use Weapon Origin
bit.tooltip: instead of coming out of the magic first person camera origin, the projectiles for this weapon actually come out of the gun

bit.name: Ejects During Chamber
bit.tooltip: this trigger's ejection port is started during the key frame of its chamber animation

bit.name: Projectile Vector Cannot Be Adjusted
bit.tooltip: projectiles fired by this weapon cannot have their direction adjusted by the AI to hit the target

bit.name: Projectiles Fire Parallel
bit.tooltip: If there are multiple guns for this trigger, the projectiles emerge in parallel beams (rather than independent aiming)

bit.name: Don't Clear Fire Bit After Recovering
Prevent Marker Deviation
bit.tooltip: the barrel will not fire if all markers are pointed further away from the desired aiming vector than the aim assist deviation angle

bit.name: Error Ignores Zoom
bit.tooltip: disables of the barrel error inversely with the zoom magnification

bit.name: Projectile Fires In Marker Direction
bit.tooltip: projectiles shoot out the marker direction instead of the player's aim vector

bit.name: Skip Test For Object Being Outside BSP
bit.tooltip: Prevents projectile origin from changing when object is outside of BSP; Useful for units that can be placed inside physics.

bit.name: Only Reload If All Barrels Idle
Only Switch Weapons If Barrel Idle
bit.tooltip: the weapon's owner cannot switch weapons unless this barrel is in the idle state

rangef.name: Rounds Per Second
rangef.tooltip: the number of firing effects created per second

stringid.name: Rate Of Fire Acceleration
stringid.tooltip: function value sets the current rate of fire when the barrel is firing

float32.name: Acceleration Time
float32.tooltip: the continuous firing time it takes for the weapon to achieve its final rounds per second

stringid.name: Rate Of Fire Deceleration
stringid.tooltip: function value sets the current rate of fire when the barrel is not firing

float32.name: Deceleration Time
float32.tooltip: the continuous idle time it takes for the weapon to return from its final rounds per second to its initial

float32.name: Barrel Spin Scale
float32.tooltip: scale the barrel spin speed by this amount

float32.name: Blurred Rate Of Fire
float32.tooltip: a percentage between 0 and 1 which controls how soon in its firing animation the weapon blurs

range16.name: Shots Per Fire
range16.tooltip: allows designer caps to the shots you can fire from one firing action

float32.name: Fire Recovery Time
float32.tooltip: how long after a set of shots it takes before the barrel can fire again

float32.name: Soft Recovery Fraction
float32.tooltip: how much of the recovery allows shots to be queued

float32.name: Melee Fire Recovery Time
float32.tooltip: how long after a set of shots it takes before the weapon can melee

float32.name: Melee Soft Recovery Fraction
float32.tooltip: how much of the melee recovery allows melee to be queued

int16.name: Magazine Index
int16.tooltip: the magazine from which this trigger draws its ammunition

int16.name: Rounds Per Shot
int16.tooltip: the number of rounds expended to create a single firing effect

int16.name: Minimum Rounds Loaded
int16.tooltip: the minimum number of rounds necessary to fire the weapon

int16.name: Rounds Between Tracers
int16.tooltip: the number of non-tracer rounds fired between tracers

enum16.name: Firing Noise
enum16.tooltip: how loud this weapon appears to the AI

option.name: Silent
option.tooltip: ai will not respond to this sound

option.name: Loud
option.tooltip: ai can hear this sound at any range

tagblock.comment: what the behavior of this barrel is in a predicted network game

float32.name: Event Synchronized Projectiles Per Second
float32.tooltip: Valid only for barrels set to prediction type "continuous". Controls how many projectiles per second can be individually synchronized (use debug_projectiles to diagnose).

float32.name: Maximum Barrel Error For Event Synchronization
float32.tooltip: Valid only for barrels set to prediction type "continuous". If the barrel's current error level is over this value (zero to one scale), we will not consider synchronizing projectiles with individual events (use debug_projectiles to diagnose).

tagblock.comment: full error look pitch rate controlls how fast you can turn with full error, yaw is implied from pitch. 0==130. for reference, profile sensitivities are set to: 1: 40 3: 60 9: 130

float32.name: Deceleration Time
float32.tooltip: the continuous idle time it would take for a barrel_error of 1.0 to return to its minimum value. Minimum value is usually 0.0 but sprinting can override this. See 'globals@Player information.momentum and sprinting.min weapon error'

rangef.name: Damage Error
rangef.tooltip: the range of angles (in degrees) that a damaged weapon will skew fire

float32.name: Look Pitch Error Power
float32.tooltip: use to soften or sharpen the rate ding

tagblock.name: Custom Vectors
tagblock.tooltip: Custom vectors must be set in distribution function above

point2.name: Point Offset
point2.tooltip: x-y offset - +x is right, +y is up

degree.name: Distribution Angle
degree.tooltip: used by distribution function 'horizontal fan' above

degree.name: Minimum Error
degree.tooltip: projectile direction is randomly selected between this and max_error_angle below

ranged.name: Error Angle
ranged.tooltip: current barrel_error is linearly interpolated between these to generate max_error_angle

float32.name: Reload Penalty
float32.tooltip: percentage accuracy lost when reloading

float32.name: Switch Penalty
float32.tooltip: percentage accuracy lost when switching weapons

float32.name: Zoom Penalty
float32.tooltip: percentage accuracy lost when zooming in/out

float32.name: Jump Penalty
float32.tooltip: percentage accuracy lost when jumping

tagblock.comment: barrel_error = barrel_error + penaltyfunction(barrel_error) Where input value 'X' produces output value 'Y'

tagblock.name: Firing Penalty Function
tagblock.tooltip: percentage accuracy lost when the barrel has fired

tagblock.name: Firing Crouched Penalty Function
tagblock.tooltip: percentage accuracy lost when the barrel has fired from a crouched position

tagblock.name: Turning Penalty Function
tagblock.tooltip: percentage accuracy lost when turning the camera

float32.name: Error Angle Maximum Rotation
float32.tooltip: angle which represents the maximum input to the turning penalty function.

tagblock.name: Firing Penalty Function
tagblock.tooltip: percentage accuracy lost when the barrel has fired

tagblock.name: Firing Crouched Penalty Function
tagblock.tooltip: percentage accuracy lost when the barrel has fired from a crouched position

tagblock.name: Turning Penalty Function
tagblock.tooltip: percentage accuracy lost when turning the camera

float32.name: Error Angle Maximum Rotation
float32.tooltip: angle which represents the maximum input to the turning penalty function.

point3.name: First Person Offset
point3.tooltip: +x is forward, +z is up, +y is left

float32.name: Ejection Port Recovery Time
float32.tooltip: the amount of time (in seconds) it takes for the ejection port to transition from 1.0 (open) to 0.0 (closed) after a shot has been fired

float32.name: Illumination Recovery Time
float32.tooltip: the amount of time (in seconds) it takes the illumination function to transition from 1.0 (bright) to 0.0 (dark) after a shot has been fired

float32.name: Heat Generated Per Round
float32.tooltip: the amount of heat generated each time the barrel fires. Unlike the name suggests, this amount of heat is NOT applied per projectile created.

stringid.name: Heat Generated Per Round Function
stringid.tooltip: function value sets the amount of heat to add to the weapon each tick the barrel is firing

float32.name: Age Generated Per Round
float32.tooltip: the amount the weapon ages each time the trigger is fired

float32.name: Campaign Age Generated Per Round
float32.tooltip: the amount the weapon ages each time the trigger is fired

float32.name: Overload Time
float32.tooltip: the next trigger fires this often while holding down this trigger

tagblock.name: Firing Effects
tagblock.tooltip: firing effects determine what happens when this trigger is fired

int16.name: Shot Count Lower Bound
int16.tooltip: the minimum number of times this firing effect will be used, once it has been chosen

int16.name: Shot Count Upper Bound
int16.tooltip: the maximum number of times this firing effect will be used, once it has been chosen

tagRef.name: Firing Effect
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and fired normally

tagRef.name: Critical Effect
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and will do critical damage

tagRef.name: Misfire Effect
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded but fired while overheated

tagRef.name: Empty Effect
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is not loaded

tagRef.name: Firing Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and fired normally

tagRef.name: Critical Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and will do critical damage

tagRef.name: Misfire Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded but fired while overheated

tagRef.name: Empty Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is not loaded

tagRef.name: Firing Rider Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and fired normally

tagRef.name: Critical Rider Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and will do critical damage

tagRef.name: Misfire Rider Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded but fired while overheated

tagRef.name: Empty Rider Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is not loaded

tagblock.name: Scaleshot Parameters
tagblock.tooltip: Allows the weapon to scale up and fire different projectiles based upon how many hits you get etc.

bit.name: Level Latches
bit.tooltip: if true, once you hit a power level, you stay at that level or higher until your power value hits 0; otherwise your power level is recomputed constantly

float32.name: Power Per Shot
float32.tooltip: the amount of scaleshot power you get when this weapon is fired

float32.name: Power Per Hit
float32.tooltip: the amount of scaleshot power you get when a projectile from this weapon hits an enemy

float32.name: Power Change Per Second
float32.tooltip: the change per second in power

tagblock.name: Power Levels
tagblock.tooltip: IMPORTANT: put these in increasing order, by "minimum power level". I claim no responsibility for weird behavior if they're out of order.

bit.name: Cannot Gain Power At This Level
bit.tooltip: if true, as long as the weapon is at this level, you cannot gain positive power, only negative values are applied

float32.name: Minimum Power Level
float32.tooltip: the minimum power at which this scaleshot level kicks in

float32.name: Power Change Per Shot
float32.tooltip: the change per shot in power when you're at this level

float32.name: Power Change Per Second
float32.tooltip: the change per second in power when you're at this level

tagRef.name: Projectile
tagRef.tooltip: the projectile to fire at this level

tagblock.name: Firing Effects
tagblock.tooltip: firing effects when firing at this level

int16.name: Shot Count Lower Bound
int16.tooltip: the minimum number of times this firing effect will be used, once it has been chosen

int16.name: Shot Count Upper Bound
int16.tooltip: the maximum number of times this firing effect will be used, once it has been chosen

tagRef.name: Firing Effect
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and fired normally

tagRef.name: Critical Effect
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and will do critical damage

tagRef.name: Misfire Effect
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded but fired while overheated

tagRef.name: Empty Effect
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is not loaded

tagRef.name: Firing Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and fired normally

tagRef.name: Critical Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and will do critical damage

tagRef.name: Misfire Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded but fired while overheated

tagRef.name: Empty Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is not loaded

tagRef.name: Firing Rider Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and fired normally

tagRef.name: Critical Rider Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and will do critical damage

tagRef.name: Misfire Rider Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is loaded but fired while overheated

tagRef.name: Empty Rider Damage
tagRef.tooltip: this effect is used when the weapon is not loaded

float32.name: Per Kill Or Hit Aging Amount
float32.tooltip: aging applied for 'weapon ages when damage is inflicted' or 'weapon ages with each kill' flags

float32.name: Age Recovered Per Second
float32.tooltip: the amount of age the weapon recovers per second

tagref.name: Age Fully Recovered Sound/Effect
tagref.tooltip: the sound or effect played when the weapon's age reaches fully recovered

rangef.name: Support Third Person Camera Range
rangef.tooltip: range in degrees. 0 is straight, -90 is down, 90 is up

float32.name: Weapon Ready 1st Person Animation Playback Scale
float32.tooltip: e.g. - 2.0 makes playspeed twice as fast

float32.name: Tether Transition To Linked Time
float32.tooltip: begins when tethered projectile is LINKED

float32.name: Tether Transition From Linked Time
float32.tooltip: begins when tethered projectile becomes non-LINKED

bit.name: Overrides Unit And Camera Screen Effects

tagRef.name: Player Sound Bank
tagRef.tooltip: High quality player sound bank to be prefetched. Can be empty.

stringid.name: Player EQ Preset Name
stringid.tooltip: Name of the EQ shareset in WWise to apply when this weapon is active

stringid.name: Reload Cancel Event
stringid.tooltip: Note - this is a direct event string - not a .sound

int32.name: Attachment Index
int32.tooltip: Sound attachment to affect - leave empty for main body

float32.name: Switch Point
float32.tooltip: value of the function (between 0 and 1) where the sound is triggered

int32.name: Mode
int32.tooltip: 0 for triggering while function is decreasing, 1 for increasing (more modes to come?)
